page.title: 03Transport cont.
page.content: The Railway track was layed down in 1856 as a two line track, it is now a single track with a spur running to Sizewell.This is used for the collection of nuclear waste from Sizewell Power Station. Trains run from Ipswich to Lowestoft and return, tickets are bought on the train. The fare at present is one pound fifty pence from Saxmundham to Ipswich, singe journey. Tickets for longer journeys are purchased at the Station Restaurant. Automatic barriers have recently been installed at the Chantry Road and Station Approach junctions.
